original_text:
**INSTITUTION
CRITICAL CARE MEDICINE
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN PROGRESS NOTE
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[TTT]
**NAME[VVV UUU]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Nov 19 2007]
EVALUATION DATE :
**DATE[Dec 12 07]
Mr. **NAME[AAA] is without complaints this morning .
On examination his fever curve has come down nicely .
His vital signs are stable .
His heart rate has come down into the 90 's .
His abdomen is soft and nondistended and nontender .
Breath sounds are somewhat diminished at the base with some bronchial breath sounds posteriorly .
Extremities are warm and dry .
Laboratory examination shows BUN and creatinine of 38 and 1.2 today .
Ins and outs were overall net balanced in last 24 hours , 1.5 liters of urine output .
White blood cell count 8000 .
Blood cultures showing gram-positive cocci from a aerobic and anaerobic bottles drawn from the PICC line .
The plan today is to pull his PICC catheter .
I ordered a repeat peripheral blood cultures x 2 .
He remains empirically on Zosyn , Flagyl , and Vancomycin .
I suspect the PICC line infection is the most likely site of his fevers and rigors that occurred previously .
I stopped his TPN today when we got the PICC line .
I left him on to D5 normal saline .
He is a stable for transfer to 9G today .
Vascular surgeons should be by sometime this afternoon to write transfer orders .
___________________________________
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
Dictator :
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
**INITIALS
D :
**DATE[Dec 12 2007] 17:06:38
T :
**DATE[Dec 13 2007] 14:03:52
R :
**DATE[Dec 13 2007] 14:03:52/dsp
Job ID :
385911 /**ID-NUM
CC:
*** Dictated By :
-**NAME[XXX , SSS M]. ***
Electronically Signed by **NAME[WWW XXX]
**DATE[Jan 19 2008] 02:55:11 PM
